flow.descriptionCdata:
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.06eaa141-9c22-4a4d-9cf5-b96a40efed4f.prompt=Enter a value for dnsServer 1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.1ebe9aa6-00d2-45b9-b2da-8068cfd1e563.description=
Searches for specific properties in LDAP. Returns a list of the values of the given properties for the first object that passes the filter (given in the corresponding input). The rest of the property values (for the other objects) are stored in a collection that is accessible via the LDAP Search Next Result operation.

Input Parameters\:
host - name or IP address of LDAP server to query. Can also be used in the form " host\:port"
dn - base DN for search
filter - search filter (see Note section)
propertyNames - names of properties to return (ex. distinguishedName,telephoneNumber)
username - name of user to connect to LDAP as
password - password of user
port - specify the port in case it is not the default one, or it is not specified in the host path
delimiter - a delimiter to separate the property names in the input and the property values in the result; if no value is assigned the delimiter is set to "," by default
useADAuth - add this input and set to false if using a non AD LDAP server. If false, uses ServerBind instead of secure NTLM based bind.
searchScope - the scope for doing the search. Permitted values\: Base -limits the search to the base object-, OneLevel -searches the immediate child objects of the base object, excluding the base object- or Subtree -searches the whole subtree, including the base object and all its child objects-. If the scope of a directory search is not specified, a Subtree type of search is performed. 

Responses\:
object(s) retrieved - was able to retrieve objects and property values from LDAP. First value returned as returnResult result
no objects found - no objects were found
failure - an invalid or duplicate property name was provided or an error occured. See returnResult for more information

Note\:
The filter input can be a simple filter, or a composed one. The filter can be composed by the rules described in "RFC2254 - The String Representation of LDAP Search Filters" which can be found at http\://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2254.html.  

Example of valid filters\:
member\=CN\=User1,CN\=Users,DC\=mydomain,DC\=local
(|(numsubordinates\=1)(entryid\=15))
(&(mobile\=*)(name\=abcd))
(&(objectClass\=Person)(|(sn\=Jensen)(cn\=Babs J*)))
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.24ff161d-bed1-4f62-9196-8660e5fc9d42.prompt=User sAMAccountName\: 1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.2f976150-1c61-44a6-a642-3d8dd9cc87a9.prompt=Enter a value for domain 1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.310105d0-78bb-48f6-952c-7398ad83e241.prompt=Alternate Credentials - UserName\: 1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.3257fb1c-87c6-4720-ae3b-ada86d9b1657.prompt=Alternate Credentials - Password\: 1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.3e057507-0c99-4d10-afb8-0bfdfc75ef3e.description=
Searches for specific properties in LDAP. Returns a list of the values of the given properties for the first object that passes the filter (given in the corresponding input). The rest of the property values (for the other objects) are stored in a collection that is accessible via the LDAP Search Next Result operation.

Input Parameters\:
host - name or IP address of LDAP server to query. Can also be used in the form " host\:port"
dn - base DN for search
filter - search filter (see Note section)
propertyNames - names of properties to return (ex. distinguishedName,telephoneNumber)
username - name of user to connect to LDAP as
password - password of user
port - specify the port in case it is not the default one, or it is not specified in the host path
delimiter - a delimiter to separate the property names in the input and the property values in the result; if no value is assigned the delimiter is set to "," by default
useADAuth - add this input and set to false if using a non AD LDAP server. If false, uses ServerBind instead of secure NTLM based bind.
searchScope - the scope for doing the search. Permitted values\: Base -limits the search to the base object-, OneLevel -searches the immediate child objects of the base object, excluding the base object- or Subtree -searches the whole subtree, including the base object and all its child objects-. If the scope of a directory search is not specified, a Subtree type of search is performed. 

Responses\:
object(s) retrieved - was able to retrieve objects and property values from LDAP. First value returned as returnResult result
no objects found - no objects were found
failure - an invalid or duplicate property name was provided or an error occured. See returnResult for more information

Note\:
The filter input can be a simple filter, or a composed one. The filter can be composed by the rules described in "RFC2254 - The String Representation of LDAP Search Filters" which can be found at http\://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2254.html.  

Example of valid filters\:
member\=CN\=User1,CN\=Users,DC\=mydomain,DC\=local
(|(numsubordinates\=1)(entryid\=15))
(&(mobile\=*)(name\=abcd))
(&(objectClass\=Person)(|(sn\=Jensen)(cn\=Babs J*)))
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.4484704e-adf8-4bd5-a29c-6ddf03a38c3d.description=
Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers

Inputs\:
operator - The operation to perform (+, -, *, /, <, >, <\=, >\=, \=\=, \!\=).
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.48abfcf8-41ca-47c1-844d-4ba920c9ee48.description=
Finds the primary domain controller for a domain via DNS lookup.

Inputs\:
domain - The name of the domain to find the domain controller for.
dnsServer - The DNS server to query.

Responses\:
success - PDC retrieved.
failure - something went wrong.

Returns\:
The fully qualified host name of the PDC.
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.49e7998e-f563-43ea-bd73-1a4f1b75e8d1.prompt=Alternate Credentials - UserName\: 1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.5f0db4b3-58a9-4006-9373-2e40fd5ec4e2.description=
Converts an string date time to an Active Directory Time Stamp (Integer8)

Input Parameters\:
adTimeStamp - string representation of the time stamp returned by ad

Responses\:
Passed - converted successfully (value is op result)
Failed - failed to convert
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.6afa53aa-d2d4-432c-97f3-c5ca64622622.description=
Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers

Inputs\:
operator - The operation to perform (+, -, *, /, <, >, <\=, >\=, \=\=, \!\=).
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.6f6a2877-0130-4191-9fd2-2b8692c85e89.prompt=DNSserver\: 1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.79959ebf-26ed-4167-b1b9-dd481123fe68.description=
Gets the DN of the root domain in active directory.

Inputs\:
host - An active directory domain controller.
altuser - The user to authenticate to host as.
altpass - The password for altuser.

Responses\:
success - DN retrieved successfully.
failure - Unable to retrieve DN.

Results\:
domainDN - the distinguished name of the root domain
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.7cfb8f2d-4a2c-47e5-ae2d-fd148422879f.description=
Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers

Inputs\:
operator - The operation to perform (+, -, *, /, <, >, <\=, >\=, \=\=, \!\=).
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.83a85d68-b1a4-4832-897b-2621084fcddb.description=Replaces a substring within a string. 
Inputs\:
input - the master string.
replace - the text to replace.
replaceWith - the text to replace with.

Results\:
the string with the text replaced.

Responses\:
success - succeeded in updating string.
failure - was unable to replace for some reason
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.9d6c6e0a-27aa-4566-bb65-2e2284df9b79.description=
Check the current date and time, and returns a java DateAndTime formatted string of it. If locale is specified, it will return the date and time string based on the locale.Otherwise, default locale will be used.

Inputs\:
localeLang - The locale language for date and time string. For example,  en or ja.
localeCountry - The locale country for date and time string. For example, US or JP. If localeLang is not specified, this input will be ingored.

Result\:
Current date and time.

Responses\:
success - Date/time retrieved successfully.
failure - Date/time could not be retrieved.
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.b8b0ffe2-78a0-45db-8857-d858b55dd479.description=
Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers

Inputs\:
operator - The operation to perform (+, -, *, /, <, >, <\=, >\=, \=\=, \!\=).
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.b8c2eab5-5889-4860-90b3-ba147d1acb3b.prompt=Alternate Credentials - Password\: 1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.description=
Finds the primary domain controller for a domain via DNS lookup and checks to see if an account is locked.

Inputs\:
    domain - The name of the domain to find the domain controller for (for example, domain.com)
    dnsServer - The DNS server to query (for example, dnsserver.domain.com)
    mbuser -The value of the sAMAccountName attribute of the user whose mailbox is checked
    altuser - The username to use when authenticating with the host (for example, domain/username)
    altpass - The password for altuser

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.e3490b74-388b-4ed1-9fc1-981f96b5e762.prompt=Domain\: 1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.e4a0e77c-2f04-4bb1-bc31-72909cf11916.description=
Executes an Expression (e.x value1 \=\= value2)

Input Parameters\:
value1 - the value to threshold with
value2 - the threshold to threshold against
operator - (\=\=, \!\=,  >, >\=, <, <\=) the type of threshold
okstring - string to push into returnResult if the threshold has not been passed
failedstring - string to push into the returnResult if the threshold has been passed

Responses\:
True - the expression is true
Fales - the expression is false
1cdb5cdd-7463-4037-807a-6b864fc977c7.f88bc4a9-d1d0-4849-ad4a-27ca2e266f45.description=
Searches for specific properties in LDAP. Returns a list of the values of the given properties for the first object that passes the filter (given in the corresponding input).
